body_html: We found that a = 1 - torch.tensor([1]).to('cuda:1') should put a in cuda:1, but the result of a.device is cuda:0 which is incorrect, hence the illegal memory access error when trying to access a's memory (e.g. when printing). I will investigate more into this next week.

body: We found that `a = 1 - torch.tensor([1]).to('cuda:1')` should put `a` in `cuda:1`, but the result of `a.device` is `cuda:0` which is incorrect, hence the illegal memory access error when trying to access `a`'s memory (e.g. when printing). I will investigate more into this next week.
